<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
TRADE
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2019/05/10/tweet-policy?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
From Tweet to Policy
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">We end the week where we started, feeling all <img src="https://emojipedia-us.s3.dualstack.us-west-1.amazonaws.com/thumbs/120/apple/198/face-with-uneven-eyes-and-wavy-mouth_1f974.png" class="img-responsive" width="18" style="width:100% !important;max-width: 18px;" alt=""> and writing about a trade war between the world’s two largest economies. The tariff bump President Trump promised on Sunday <a href="https://www.reuters.com/article/us-usa-trade-china/first-day-of-u-s-china-trade-talks-end-trumps-tariff-hike-set-to-take-effect-idUSKCN1SF2BF?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">went into effect</a> at 12:01am last night when the two sides couldn’t agree on a deal they’ve been negotiating for months.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">The bump: </strong>The 10% tariffs on $200 billion in Chinese goods are now 25%. That’ll affect over <a href="https://www.reuters.com/article/us-usa-trade-china-tariffs/u-s-customs-agency-issues-notice-of-higher-tariff-rate-on-chinese-goods-idUSKCN1SF2DV?feedType=RSS&feedName=businessNews&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">5,700</a> import categories, but not goods that are cruising the Pacific on their way to the U.S. from China.  </p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">How we got here</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Trade talks <a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/stories/president-trump-throws-a-curveball-on-trade/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">hit a wall</a> in the past few weeks as U.S. officials accused China of backing out of crucial promises (China disputes this). And not even a “<a href="https://www.reuters.com/article/us-usa-trade-china-letter/trump-says-he-has-received-beautiful-letter-from-chinas-xi-idUSKCN1SF22M?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">beautiful letter</a>” sent from Chinese President Xi Jinping could sway Trump, who’d been hitting China over unfair trade practices well before he even ran for office.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">For most of you, trade war headlines have so far mostly been just that—headlines. Tariffs haven’t hit most consumer products like they have <a href="https://www.axios.com/trump-trade-war-soybean-farmers-prices-china-74df82e6-d6d4-4669-82cc-7f7da2d5061a.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">farmers</a> and manufacturers. But things could change with the tariff hike <em>and </em>Trump’s <a href="https://apnews.com/36e1ffcdd3a94b85806c8b4d415e2e31?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">threat</a> to slap tariffs on $325 billion more in Chinese goods.</p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">What happens next?</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">It’s not like the U.S. raises tariffs on Chinese goods and we all go have a margarita. China <em>will </em>respond, which, <a href="https://www.nytimes.com/2019/05/09/business/trump-china-tariffs.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">per the NYT</a>, could include instituting retaliatory tariffs or mobilizing its consumers to boycott American products. That’s why most economists consider trade barriers like tariffs a lose-lose. China’s <a href="https://www.axios.com/trump-trade-war-china-united-states-eurozone-global-economy-cbbfcddb-ad79-48ea-860e-30caf11787a7.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">stock market</a> agrees.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Of course, President Trump doesn’t see it that way. His administration has alleged China’s been ripping U.S. companies off, particularly through stealing IP. He views tariffs as the best tool to force China to abandon those practices.  </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Looking ahead: </strong>Negotiators will be hitting the coffee and donuts hard as talks resume today...but under much different circumstances.</p>

<a href="https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?text=How+we+got+here+and+where+we%27re+going&url=https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2019/05/10/tweet-policy&via=MorningBrew" target="_blank" rel="noopener" style="text-decoration: none;" class="">

<div class="c6 " style="margin-bottom:7px">
<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
UBER IPO
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2019/05/10/uber-nestles-place-history?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Uber Nestles Into Its Place in History
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Uber’s monster <a href="https://www.nytimes.com/2019/05/05/business/dealbook/uber-ipo.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">$8.1 billion IPO</a> today will be one of the biggest in U.S. history and the largest since <a href="https://www.nyse.com/network/article/Alibaba-Lists-on-the-NYSE?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Alibaba</a> in 2014. Like, your kids will TikTok about this someday.</p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">How’d it get so big?</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Milk with dinner. Plus...just waiting it out. Uber’s one of the many high-octane startups <a href="https://www.nytimes.com/interactive/2019/05/09/business/dealbook/tech-ipos-uber.html?emc=edit_NN_p_20190509&nl=morning-briefing&nlid=86730654tion%3DtopNews&section=topNews&te=1&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">hitting the public market</a> this year with almost a decade of experience under their belts. Staying private for longer means tapping VCs’ increasingly deep pockets and avoiding the Simon Cowells of the public markets.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>From 1995-2005, the average age of a company going public was three years.</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Now, it’s 11 years.</span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">And valuations are also on the up. </strong>When Amazon (1997) and Yahoo (1996) went public, they were worth less than $500 million. The average valuation of VC-backed U.S. tech firms going public today is $9.6 billion, and 2019’s grand total could top $150 billion.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">But even at that size...</strong>Uber <em>has</em> <a href="https://www.npr.org/2019/05/09/721562757/ubers-eye-popping-ipo-approaches-is-it-really-worth-90-billion?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">tempered expectations</a> in light of rival Lyft’s nearly 30% slump from its own IPO price. Instead of the $120 billion valuation some investors floated, Uber <a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2019/05/09/uber-ipo-pricing.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">landed</a> on $82.4 billion.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">+ By the way, we weren't joking yesterday. We'll be near the NYSE tailgating the IPO this morning. Come join or follow along on <a href="https://www.instagram.com/morningbrew/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Instagram</a>. </p>

<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
ENERGY
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2019/05/10/occidental-swoops-chevron-bows?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Occidental Swoops In, Chevron Bows Out
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">If you’re a Texas oil driller, you dance with the one that brung ya...or the one that offers a sweeter deal. Yesterday, Chevron (+3.14%) <a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2019/05/09/chevron-will-not-raise-offer-for-anadarko-petroleum-company-says.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">said</a> it would not submit a new bid to take over Anadarko Petroleum (-3.26%), leaving the much smaller Occidental (-6.44%) holding the keys to a pretty nice ride. Anadarko is a key operator in the Permian Basin, which has helped fuel the recent U.S. oil boom. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">Occidental’s offer?</strong></span><span> $38 billion (78% cash and 22% stock) with </span><span><a href="https://www.axios.com/warren-buffett-anadarko-occidental-chevron-e5172edd-55b6-4b11-9821-72712ae8b654.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">financial support</a></span><span> from one Warren Buffett.</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">Chevron’s offer? </strong></span><span>$33 billion. CEO Mike Wirth said Occidental was lucky his friends held him back: “Make no mistake about it, we had the financial capacity to easily outbid Occidental,” </span><span><a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2019-05-09/chevron-s-mr-discipline-shows-costs-matter-as-anadarko-bid-ends?srnd=premium&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">he told Bloomberg</a></span><span>. Chevron will receive a $1 billion “breakup fee,” which it will use to buy back shares.</span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Zoom out: </strong>This deal makes underdog Occidental the third-largest U.S. oil company and the biggest player in the hyper-productive Permian sandbox. One analyst who will never be a Brew writer <a href="https://www.reuters.com/article/us-anadarko-petrol-m-a-occidental-hollub/from-paris-to-omaha-how-occidental-ceo-out-maneuvered-chevron-in-anadarko-bid-idUSKCN1SF1TW?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">called it</a> “the boldest M&A thing that’s happened since the ’80s.”</p>

<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
SPACE
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2019/05/10/fly-moon-jeff-bezos?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Fly Me to the Moon, Jeff Bezos
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Bezos’s private spaceflight company, Blue Origin, just <a href="https://www.cnn.com/business/live-news/jeff-bezos-blue-origin-announcement/index.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">unveiled</a> its Blue Moon lunar lander—step one in creating self-sustaining colonies in space.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">At yesterday’s presser, Bezos revealed an entirely new way of thinking about space colonization once this planet goes kablooey.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">The strategy:</strong></span><span> Forget distant planets, Elon. Bezos wants to build massive spaceborne structures called “O’Neill Worlds,” complete with people, animals, plants, and alive girls.</span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Getting there starts with “gateways,” Bezos said, like Blue Moon.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>The </span><span><a href="https://www.popularmechanics.com/space/rockets/a27422722/jeff-bezos-blue-moon-lunar-lander/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">lunar lander</a></span><span> will be able to transport massive amounts of cargo and run on liquid hydrogen.</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>It’ll get a new engine called the BE-7. That could test fire for the first time this summer.</span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Zoom out: </strong>VP Mike Pence wants astronauts back on the moon by 2024, and someone’s gotta get them there. Far less use of the word “Sputnik” this time around, but the money on the line in the 21st century’s space race has given the U.S. “perhaps the <a href="https://qz.com/1603659/elon-musk-and-jeff-bezos-wrangle-over-us-military-rockets/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">deepest industrial base</a> for space-launch in world history,” as Quartz's Tim Fernholz writes.</p>

<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
QUIZ
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2019/05/10/lean-quizine?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Lean Quizine
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">A stronger TV lineup than the XFL. More caffeinated than Luckin and Starbucks...combined. Actually knows what “camp” means. It’s the Brew’s Weekly News Quiz.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">1. <strong style="color:#000">What was Uber’s original name</strong> back when it was started in 2009? Bonus point: Name its two (2) co-founders.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">2. <strong style="color:#000">The U.S. has imposed</strong> a 17.5% import duty on tomatoes from which country?</p>
<ol type="a">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>China</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Mexico</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Canada</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Russia</span></li>
</ol>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">3. <strong style="color:#000">Who said this: </strong>"When you find a problem you have to do something about it, and I think that’s where they probably made a mistake at Wells Fargo, and they made it at Salomon."</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">4. <strong style="color:#000">What were the odds </strong>that Country House, the de facto Kentucky Derby champion, would win the race?</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">5. <strong style="color:#000">Fill in the blank: </strong>Google CEO Sundar Pichai said his company is working on making sure _________ is "fair and works for everyone."</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">6. <strong style="color:#000">Which recently public food company</strong> is partnering with the corporation that owns Hooters to offer some...unique burger options?</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><small><strong style="color:#000"><em>Answers: </em></strong><em>1) UberCab, Travis Kalanick and Garrett Camp 2) Mexico 3) Warren Buffett at his annual shareholders meeting 4) 65-1 5) Artificial intelligence 6) Beyond Meat</em></small></p>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">

style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0\"\u003e\nTRADE\n\u003c/h3\u003e\n\u003ch1 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, style=\"color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;\"\u003e\n\u003cfont color=\"#000000\"\u003e\nFrom Tweet to Policy\n\u003c/font\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\n\u003c/h1\u003e\n\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003c/table\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eWe end the week where we started, feeling all \u003cimg src=\"https://emojipedia-us.s3.dualstack.us-west-1.amazonaws.com/thumbs/120/apple/198/face-with-uneven-eyes-and-wavy-mouth_1f974.png\" class=\"img-responsive\" width=\"18\" style=\"width:100% !important;max-width: 18px;\" alt=\"\"\u003e and writing about a trade war between the world’s two largest economies. The tariff bump President Trump promised on Sunday \u003ca href=\"https://www.reuters.com/article/us-usa-trade-china/first-day-of-u-s-china-trade-talks-end-trumps-tariff-hike-set-to-take-effect-idUSKCN1SF2BF?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ewent into effect\u003c/a\u003e at 12:01am last night when the two sides couldn’t agree on a deal they’ve been negotiating for months.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eThe bump: \u003c/strong\u003eThe 10% tariffs on $200 billion in Chinese goods are now 25%. That’ll affect over \u003ca href=\"https://www.reuters.com/article/us-usa-trade-china-tariffs/u-s-customs-agency-issues-notice-of-higher-tariff-rate-on-chinese-goods-idUSKCN1SF2DV?feedType=RSS\u0026feedName=businessNews\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003e5,700\u003c/a\u003e import categories, but not goods that are cruising the Pacific on their way to the U.S. from China.  \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eHow we got here\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eTrade talks \u003ca href=\"https://www.morningbrew.com/stories/president-trump-throws-a-curveball-on-trade/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ehit a wall\u003c/a\u003e in the past few weeks as U.S. officials accused China of backing out of crucial promises (China disputes this). And not even a “\u003ca href=\"https://www.reuters.com/article/us-usa-trade-china-letter/trump-says-he-has-received-beautiful-letter-from-chinas-xi-idUSKCN1SF22M?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ebeautiful letter\u003c/a\u003e” sent from Chinese President Xi Jinping could sway Trump, who’d been hitting China over unfair trade practices well before he even ran for office.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eFor most of you, trade war headlines have so far mostly been just that—headlines. Tariffs haven’t hit most consumer products like they have \u003ca href=\"https://www.axios.com/trump-trade-war-soybean-farmers-prices-china-74df82e6-d6d4-4669-82cc-7f7da2d5061a.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003efarmers\u003c/a\u003e and manufacturers. But things could change with the tariff hike \u003cem\u003eand \u003c/em\u003eTrump’s \u003ca href=\"https://apnews.com/36e1ffcdd3a94b85806c8b4d415e2e31?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ethreat\u003c/a\u003e to slap tariffs on $325 billion more in Chinese goods.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eWhat happens next?\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eIt’s not like the U.S. raises tariffs on Chinese goods and we all go have a margarita. China \u003cem\u003ewill \u003c/em\u003erespond, which, \u003ca href=\"https://www.nytimes.com/2019/05/09/business/trump-china-tariffs.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eper the NYT\u003c/a\u003e, could include instituting retaliatory tariffs or mobilizing its consumers to boycott American products. That’s why most economists consider trade barriers like tariffs a lose-lose. China’s \u003ca href=\"https://www.axios.com/trump-trade-war-china-united-states-eurozone-global-economy-cbbfcddb-ad79-48ea-860e-30caf11787a7.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003estock market\u003c/a\u003e agrees.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eOf course, President Trump doesn’t see it that way. His administration has alleged China’s been ripping U.S. companies off, particularly through stealing IP. He views tariffs as the best tool to force China to abandon those practices.  \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eLooking ahead: \u003c/strong\u003eNegotiators will be hitting the coffee and donuts hard as talks resume today...but under much different Plus...just waiting it out. Uber’s one of the many high-octane startups \u003ca href=\"https://www.nytimes.com/interactive/2019/05/09/business/dealbook/tech-ipos-uber.html?emc=edit_NN_p_20190509\u0026nl=morning-briefing\u0026nlid=86730654tion%3DtopNews\u0026section=topNews\u0026te=1\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ehitting the public market\u003c/a\u003e this year with almost a decade of experience under their belts. Staying private for longer means tapping VCs’ increasingly deep pockets and avoiding the Simon Cowells of the public markets.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eFrom 1995-2005, the average age of a company going public was three years.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eNow, it’s 11 years.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eAnd valuations are also on the up. \u003c/strong\u003eWhen Amazon (1997) and Yahoo (1996) went public, they were worth less than $500 million. The average valuation of VC-backed U.S. tech firms going public today is $9.6 billion, and 2019’s grand total could top $150 billion.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBut even at that size...\u003c/strong\u003eUber \u003cem\u003ehas\u003c/em\u003e \u003ca href=\"https://www.npr.org/2019/05/09/721562757/ubers-eye-popping-ipo-approaches-is-it-really-worth-90-billion?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003etempered expectations\u003c/a\u003e in light of rival Lyft’s nearly 30% slump from its own IPO price. Instead of the $120 billion valuation some investors floated, Uber \u003ca href=\"https://www.cnbc.com/2019/05/09/uber-ipo-pricing.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003elanded\u003c/a\u003e on $82.4 billion.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e+ By the way, we weren't joking yesterday. We'll be near the NYSE tailgating the IPO this morning. style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eIf you’re a Texas oil driller, you dance with the one that brung ya...or the one that offers a sweeter deal. Yesterday, Chevron (+3.14%) \u003ca href=\"https://www.cnbc.com/2019/05/09/chevron-will-not-raise-offer-for-anadarko-petroleum-company-says.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003esaid\u003c/a\u003e it would not submit a new bid to take over Anadarko Petroleum (-3.26%), leaving the much smaller Occidental (-6.44%) holding the keys to a pretty nice ride. Anadarko is a key operator in the Permian Basin, which has helped fuel the recent U.S. oil boom. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e\n\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eOccidental’s offer?\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e $38 billion (78% cash and 22% stock) with \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.axios.com/warren-buffett-anadarko-occidental-chevron-e5172edd-55b6-4b11-9821-72712ae8b654.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003efinancial support\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e from one Warren Buffett.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e\n\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eChevron’s offer? \u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e$33 billion. CEO Mike Wirth said Occidental was lucky his friends held him back: “Make no mistake about it, we had the financial capacity to easily outbid Occidental,” \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2019-05-09/chevron-s-mr-discipline-shows-costs-matter-as-anadarko-bid-ends?srnd=premium\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ehe told Bloomberg\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e. Chevron will receive a $1 billion “breakup fee,” which it will use to buy back shares.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eZoom out: \u003c/strong\u003eThis deal makes underdog Occidental the third-largest U.S. oil company and the biggest player in the hyper-productive Permian sandbox. target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ecalled it\u003c/a\u003e “the boldest M\u0026A thing that’s happened Bezos wants to build massive spaceborne structures called “O’Neill Worlds,” complete with people, animals, plants, and alive girls.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eGetting there starts with “gateways,” Bezos said, like Blue Moon.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eThe \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.popularmechanics.com/space/rockets/a27422722/jeff-bezos-blue-moon-lunar-lander/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003elunar lander\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e will be able to transport massive amounts of cargo and run on liquid hydrogen.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eIt’ll get a new engine called the BE-7.
